The Investment

Lancaster City Council has allocated £3.5 million to Eden Project Morecambe Ltd, making it the council's fifth-largest supplier by total expenditure. This represents 2.5% of the council's total £141.4 million spend.

Context

The Eden Project Morecambe is one of the most ambitious regeneration projects in the North West, aiming to transform Morecambe's seafront with a world-class attraction. The project has been supported by significant public investment from multiple sources including the Levelling Up Fund.

Lancaster City Council's £3.5 million contribution sits alongside funding from central government and other partners. For a council with an annual budget of approximately £35 million, this represents a significant commitment to the borough's economic future.

Transparency

All payments to Eden Project Morecambe Ltd are visible in Lancaster's spending data. You can search for Eden Project transactions to see the individual payments.
